examples: I tried to approach him, but he turned away .

definitions.definition: Aside, so as to discard something.
examples: throw away , chuck away , toss away

definitions.definition: At a stated distance in time or space.
examples: Christmas is only two weeks away .

definitions.definition: In or to something's usual or proper storage place.
examples: I'll dry the dishes and you put them away .

definitions.definition: In or to a secure or out-of-the-way place.
examples: The jewels were locked away in the safe.
He was shut away in the castle tower for six months.

definitions.definition: From a state or condition of being; out of existence.
examples: I'll sleep the rest of the day away /out and, hopefully, I'll manage to sleep this hangover off/ away .

definitions.definition: So as to remove or use up something.
examples: The weather has worn away the inscription, and it is no longer legible.
Please wipe away this spilled drink.
That's where tourists go to hear great Cuban bands and dance the night away .

definitions.definition: Come away; go away; take away.
examples: Away ! Be gone! And don't let me see you round here again!

definitions.definition: On; in continuance; without intermission or delay.
examples: She's been in her room all day, working away at her computer.
I saw her whaling away at her detractors.

secondary_definitions: Aside, so as to discard something.
At a stated distance in time or space.
In or to something's usual or proper storage place.
In or to a secure or out-of-the-way place.
From a state or condition of being; out of existence.
So as to remove or use up something.
( as imperative , by ellipsis ) Come away; go away; take away.
On; in continuance; without intermission or delay.
